items.sentence: Even though Tom thought the idea didn't make much sense, he said he'd give it a go.
Tom asked his family to never buy him a skydiving voucher for any of his birthdays.

No matter how well I do something, Tom always tells me that I could've done better.
Tom lay down in the grass and looked up at the sky, with his hands behind his head.
Tom wanted to study music in college, but his parents wanted him to study medicine.
Tom can play several brass instruments, but he can't play any woodwind instruments.
Tom hit the nail on the head when he said our team lacks enthusiasm and motivation.
Tom fought his way through the flames and rescued the child from the burning house.
When Tom got his final exam paper back, and saw that he'd passed, he felt relieved.
I think that there aren't as many French speakers in Australia as there used to be.
Tom couldn't believe he was going out with one of the best-looking girls at school.
I wanted to get a tattoo on my chest, but everybody told me that was a stupid idea.
The restaurant we ate at last night was really good. You should eat there sometime.
Tom has gotten better at playing the clarinet since the last time I heard him play.
If you want to know which direction the wind is blowing, just look at the windsock.
When we started out in the summer of 2010, there were only three of us in the band.

When Tom and Mary got married, they both promised never to lie to each other again.
Tom and Mary spent the afternoon sitting on a park bench, talking about their dogs.
